intro: Symphyllia silhetense, commonly known as the Silhet grass, is a unique plant species native to the subtropical regions of Bangladesh. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, fertile soils and is often found in wetlands and riverine areas. Its flowering structure consists of small, inconspicuous spikelets, which are typical of many grass species. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable component of local biodiversity.
